channel.title: BUpolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUpolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Amazon Invests an Additional $4 Billion in Anthropic, an OpenAI Rival
item.description: The tech giant doubles its investment in the startup as it aims to compete in the AI arms race.

item.title: It’s still the economy: What TV ads tell us about each campaign’s closing message
item.description: The final paid messages: Economy, culture wars and character.

item.title: EU Drops Probe of Apple's Treatment of Rival Audiobook, Ebook Developers in App Store
item.description: The European Commission said it dropped a probe that began in 2020 after a rival developer withdrew its own complaint.

item.title: Tech, Media & Telecom Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: Find insight on VNET, Baidu and more in the latest Market Talks covering Technology, Media and Telecom.

item.title: There’s a Reason Harris’ Campaign Is Locked in on Quick Fixes
item.description: The Democratic nominee isn’t campaigning much on the Biden administration’s bigger, slower-moving policies.

item.title: Google Should Be Forced to Sell Chrome Browser, Justice Department Says
item.description: The spinoff would be a major blow to the tech giant and will likely kick off a legal fight with wide-reaching implications for its core business.

item.description: What more could Donald Trump want in an attorney general pick?

item.title: Tracking Trump’s picks for his Cabinet and administration
item.description: Here are the people Donald Trump has picked or is considering to fill his Cabinet and key positions in his administration.

item.title: A Harris pollster discusses why she lost
Harris is pounding Trump on fascism. Some Dems think that’s a mistake.
item.description: Harris has ratcheted up her warnings about the dangers of a second Trump term in recent weeks.

item.title: Live updates: Matt Gaetz out, Pam Bondi in as Trump’s attorney general pick
